intro: Agalinis laxa, commonly known as the slender bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Agalinis laxa is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
